statements.name: PROC EFA
statements.help:
PROC EFA <options>;                 
	BY  variables;                 
	DISPLAY <table-list></ options>;                 
	DISPLAYOUT  table-spec-list </ options>;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	NFACTORS  TYPE=name<options>;                 
	PRIORS  communalities;                 
	VAR  variables;                 
	WEIGHT  variable;

arguments.name: CONVERGE=
arguments.description: specifies the convergence criterion for the METHOD=ALPHA, METHOD=ML, METHOD=PRINIT, or METHOD=ULS option

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC EFA to use

arguments.name: FUZZ=
arguments.description: specifies how certain correlation and factor loading values are printed

arguments.name: GAMMA=
arguments.description: specifies the orthomax weight to be used together with the option ROTATE=ORTHOMAX or PREROTATE=ORTHOMAX

arguments.name: HEYWOOD
arguments.description: sets to 1 any communality greater than 1, allowing iterations to proceed

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations for factor extraction

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method of extracting factors

arguments.name: NFACTORS=
arguments.description: specifies how to determine the number of factors

arguments.name: NOBS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of observations to use when computing significance tests

arguments.name: NOPROMAXNORM
arguments.description: turns off the default row normalization of the prerotated factor pattern, which is used to compute the promax target matrix

arguments.name: NORM=
arguments.description: specifies the method of normalizing the rows of the factor pattern for rotation

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of threads to use in the computation, where n is an integer between 1 and 64, inclusive

arguments.name: POWER=
arguments.description: specifies the power to use in computing the target pattern for the option ROTATE=PROMAX

arguments.name: PREROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the prerotation method for the option ROTATE=PROMAX

arguments.name: PRIORS=
arguments.description: specifies a method of computing prior communality estimates

arguments.name: RCONVERGE=
arguments.description: specifies the convergence criterion value p (p > 0) for rotation cycles

arguments.name: REFSTRUCT
arguments.description: prints the reference structure and reference axis correlations

arguments.name: REORDER
arguments.description: reorders the rows (variables) of various factor matrices in the output

arguments.name: RITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of cycles for factor rotation

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the rotation method

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies the initial seed for the pseudorandom number generator for use with the option PRIORS=RANDOM

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: specifies the singularity criterion, where 0<p<1

arguments.name: TAU=
arguments.description: specifies the oblimin weight to use with the option ROTATE=OBLIMIN or PREROTATE=OBLIMIN

arguments.name: ULTRAHEYWOOD
arguments.description: allows communalities to exceed 1

arguments.name: VARDEF=
arguments.description: specifies the divisor to use for calculating variances and covariances

statements.name: BY
statements.description: produces separate analyses of observations in groups that are defined by the BY variables

statements.name: DISPLAY
statements.description: enables you to specify a list of display tables to display or exclude

arguments.name: CASESENSITIVE
arguments.description: performs a case-sensitive comparison of table names in the table-list to display table names when tables are subsetted for display

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: displays all display tables except those that you specify in the table-list

arguments.name: EXCLUDEALL
arguments.description: suppresses display of all tables

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: displays the display table names, labels, and paths

statements.name: DISPLAYOUT
statements.description: enables you to create output tables from your displayed output

arguments.name: key=
arguments.description: specifies key as the ODS table name, path, or partial pathname, and specifies value as the output table name.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: specifies key as the ODS table name and also as the output table name.

arguments.name: INCLUDEALL
arguments.description: creates output tables for all display tables

arguments.name: NOREPLACE
arguments.description: does not replace any existing output table of the same name

arguments.name: REPEATED
arguments.description: replicates all output tables on all nodes

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a numeric variable in the input data table that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: NFACTORS
statements.description: specifies a criterion to use for suggesting the number of factors to extract in an analysis

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the criterion to use for suggesting the number of factors to extract

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the one-sided alpha level for computing the critical value at the upper end of the simulated distribution of eigenvalues in a parallel analysis

arguments.name: NSIMULATIONS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of simulations to use in constructing an empirical distribution of eigenvalues for a parallel analysis

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies the initial seed for the pseudorandom number generator that is used to simulate correlation matrices for a parallel analysis

arguments.name: STATUS=
arguments.description: specifies the status of the criterion for determining the number of factors to extract

arguments.name: THRESHOLD=
arguments.description: specifies the threshold value for either a TYPE=EIGENVALUE or TYPE=PROPORTION criterion

statements.name: PRIORS
statements.description: specifies numeric values between 0.0 and 1.0 for the prior communality estimates for each variable

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: specifies the numeric variables to be analyzed

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: identifies a numeric variable in the input data table that contains the weight of each observation to perform a weighted analysis of the data
